p.span: SCHOOL WILL BE CLOSED INDEFINITELY DUE TO COVID-19
*Please see section below for updates on Lottery/enrollment information for 2020-21 School Year

p.a: Visit our "Side by Side at Home" site to see our friends, colleagues, and fellow-students in their own at-home enviornment!

img.style: width: 881px; height: 305px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block;

span.strong: **IMPORTANT UPDATE REGARDING ADMISSIONS/ SBS LOTTERY FOR
Due to school closure resulting from COVID-19, please note the following changes to the lottery and admissions process for 2020-21:

span.i: All originally scheduled Open Houses are postponed
The SBS enrollment Lottery for the 2020-21 school year will now take place on Wed, May 20 at 5pm

span.em: The lottery will be closed to the public but will be live-streamed (COMING SOON)

span.i: Applications for the lottery are now available on our website:
All completed applications will be due no later than Friday, May 8 at 4pm

em.span: Any applications received after the deadline will NOT be considered

span.strong: **PLEASE DO NOT SUBMIT DUPLICATE APPLICATIONS: If you already attended an Open House and have submitted a paper application, PLEASE DO NOT SUBMIT an additional on-line application as it will be voided. If you wish to confirm receipt of your original paper application, please email us at: lottery@sbscharter.org.

em.span: Any child who is a resident of Connecticut is eligible to apply. Applications are accepted for children entering pre-school (3 & 4 year olds) through the 8th grade. The birth date cut-off date for preschool is September 1st and December 31st for Kindergarten through eighth grades.

p.i: Once an application is reviewed and accepted, all applicants will receive a lottery number. On May 20 lottery "numbers" will be randomly drawn to determine a sequential waitlist for each grade level. (The higher up your number is on the waitlist, the greater the chances for being offered a spot for enrollment)

span.i: The SBS enrollment lottery is strictly for the purpose of creating a sequential waitlist. The waitlist wil be used to offer spots for enrollment when/if it is determined that there are vacancies at each given grade level
**Any false or inaccurate information provided on an application for enrollment will deem that application void and the applicant will be removed from the lottery process.
**If any false or inaccurate information is determined after enrollment is offered and accepted, that child's spot will be revoked and offered to the next applicant on the waitlist**
All decisions regarding eligibility and enrollment via the SBS lottery are at the discretion of The Side by Side Charter School Board of Directors

strong.i: ANY QUESTIONS REGARDING THE SBS ENROLLMENT LOTTERY FOR THE 2020-21 SCHOOL YEAR SHOULD BE DIRECTED TO: lottery@sbscharter.org
(This includes questions about the application process, eligibility requirements, cut-off birthdates, etc.)

span.span: Please use this link for some helpful information for Norwalk families from the city's health department.
This site provides information about many services available including food distribution.
Check the site frequently as updates are consistently added.

div.span: Welcome to the Side by Side Charter School Home Page

div.p: Side by Side is a regional public charter school located in the heart of downtown South Norwalk. As specified in our charter, our integrated student population reflects the diversity of our surrounding community. The 235 students of Side by Side, grades Pre-K through 8th, represent several surrounding Connecticut towns and cities.

Like all charter schools, Side by Side functions independently from any local or traditional public school system. At Side by Side, our innovative approaches toward education allow us to actively and equally involve parents, teachers, and students in our day-to-day operations.

During this unexpected closure our objective will continue to be to best provide an adequate level of teaching and learning opportunities to your children while dealing with these unplanned circumstances. The Side by Side staff and I will require a purposeful, realistic and balanced level of accountability for all children and families with regards to engaging in the learning activities that we are providing. Simultaneously, that balanced approach will provide flexibility to all families and will consider the many other hardships and interruptions that you are managing.

Lastly, I would like to remind all parents, guardians and staff to please consider the perspective of all that is happening through the lens of a child. These are unprecedented times and circumstances. I share in your anxiousness, nervousness and uncertainty. But please remember that our children see this. For them it is worse. They rely on our strength, support and reassurance that things will be alright. Talk about COVID-19, and certainly remind your children about safe practices to avoid spreading it. But at the same time, turn off the TV. Take away the iphone. Go for a walk outside. Smile and remind your kids to do the same. Together, we WILL get through this.
Looking for more? Click here for the latest What's New Wednesday or here to view this week's full Monthly News.
